Description: Very wide, shallow, asymmetrical axe-head:with top end shaped in such a way as to form, when the blade was hafted, an overlapping, double-edged projection. The upper tip is rounded, the lower pointed. There are four perforations, one of which contains the remains of the original binding. The piece is quite thickly corroded and traces of the original wooden haft are preserved. The cutting end is thin but not particularly sharp. The edge is warped and there is some indication of wear.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (77)
